Maybe you must just quickly go back to the instruction that a roadblock should be held.   What was the purpose of the roadblock?
The purpose was to look for illegitimate weapons and ammunition which was entering our towns and which was used to kill or harm old people and innocent people.
After this assault on these black people, did you then go to the Radora Crossing where you would then have the roadblock?

On our arrival there, Mr Meiring put us in specific positions, because he had the experience in order to have a roadblock.   Me myself, Matthew's and Diedericks was told to act as traffic officials.   Two other people, Visser, Etienne Visser and Mr Jaco Badenhorst, was told to stand behind the chevron board.

It was decided that the Sentra would be the emergency vehicle, with the blue light on top of it, and Kloppers and Martins would then drive in the Mercedes Benz towards Ventersdorp and as soon as they will flash their headlights to us, we'd know that this is the necessary target to pull off, and the target we would have had to pull off would only have black occupants.
Before we get to the Honda and the Cressida, can you tell us about the other vehicles?

There were several vehicles pulled off.  At one stage a vehicle was pulled off with a black person in it, and this black person resisted us, because he didn't want us to search his vehicle, and Klopper hit the man on the head with a baton and I stood watching this.
Let's interrupt ourselves, in the criminal proceedings later you were found guilty of that assault as well?
Yes, I was found guilty thereof.
In the sense that you should have foreseen it and you were an accomplice?
And you also ask for amnesty with regards to that assault?
Can you remember anything else with regards to the other vehicles before you pulled the Honda and the Sentra off?

At a later stage there was another vehicle, it was a big pick-up, Ford pick-up truck.   The car wouldn't start and we were told to push the car so that it could start, and we did that, and the vehicle drove off.
All the vehicles were searched, Chairperson.
The purpose was to try and find illegitimate weapons and ammunition.
And can the committee make the reference that no such weapons were found?
No weapons were found, illegal weapons, that is.
Evidence was given in front of the committee with regards to questions that was asked to the occupants of the vehicles.   What's your comment on that?
No questions were asked while the vehicles were searched.
I refer you specifically to questions with regards to political affiliations?

So then the Honda and the Cressida came onto the scene, and the committee know that they were stopped, or they stopped first and they both arrived there simultaneously.   Would you please take it from there?

Once they were both at the roadblock, the vehicles approached us, the Ballade was in the front and behind it the Cressida.   The Honda was pulled off.   Inside the Honda there were three people, three men.   I walked towards the vehicle.   I commanded the driver to get out, and I told him to go and sit on the ground.   The two passengers who were with him also got out and they also sat down on the ground.   The vehicle was searched where the people sat themselves as well as the boot.   The people in the Toyota Cressida did not want to get out of the car under any circumstances and then Klopper walked closer on the driver's side, he shattered the windscreen with his baton and all the passengers in that car then got out.
Maybe, while we're there, maybe we must just stop.   Is it also so that you put together a sketch plan of the scene?

Mr Chairman, may I beg leave to hand up copies of this to the committee, which I think may be of some assistance?   It would be EXHIBIT 7.
SKETCH PLAN HANDED UP AS EXHIBIT 7
Is it correct that you also submitted an explanation for this sketch?
Mr Chairman, what I did with mine is to write in precisely what everything is, so that one doesn't have to refer back every time.   Let us begin with A, what is A?
Point A is the so-called Radora Crossing.
Point B is the Ventersdorp Road.
In other words traffic that moves from left to right on that part that you've indicated there, will move towards Ventersdorp?
And C is on the other side of the road?
That is correct, Mr Chairperson, that's from Ventersdorp to Krugersdorp.
I don't, I haven't really studied this, but I wonder, have you discussed this with the other people?
Have you discussed this sketch with Mr Prinsloo, Ms Van der Walt, Mr Dreyer, (Indistinct)?
No, I have not, Mr Chairman.

I sincerely hope that it's not going to cause so much dispute, because we don't contemplate being drawn to a point where we'll have to go for an inspection in loco as a result of some disputes arising from around this point.
Well so do I, Mr Chairman, but I don't foresee such disputes.
Is it possible to deal with other aspects of the matter for the time being, to leave this aside for a while?

It is possible, Mr Chairman, but I thought that it would make it clear to the committee where everything just took place, I thought it would be of some assistance, for instance to indicate this so-called line of people that were about to shoot and the line of people sitting as people about to be shot.   It's just helpful in my view, Mr Chairman.
What is your attitude towards this?
Mr Chairman, could I take instructions on this, we don't know, so... (intervention).

I dread even looking into it, I won't like to do that.   Let's deal with other aspects of the matter if we can, and maybe tomorrow, by tomorrow Mr Prinsloo would have had a look at it, and then we can talk about it.
As you please, Mr Chairman.   Let us come back to this roadblock, what you've already said is that the Honda was searched, the people got out?
The Cressida was searched and the people got out?
After the side windscreen was shattered?
You then, as part of that search, did something personal, of which you were found guilty later on?
Yes, I did, I stole a leather jacket.
Can you tell the committee why did you do it, or what happened?
With the robbery, it wasn't just myself, it was Matthew's as well, Matthew's stole the cassettes, as well as the tools.
Was that part of the planning, part of the instruction that you received, that you must do such a thing?
Can you explain how it happened that you committed this crime?
I did it in a moment of madness.
Yes, yes I am sorry that I stole that jacket.
The occupants of the Honda and Cressida were commanded or told to go and sit.   Can you explain on what they sat and where in relation to the vehicles?
There was a type of embankment on which they sat.
This embankment, was that further away from the tar road as where the cars were?
In other words, it would have been to the left of the vehicles?
Where did you stand at that stage?
At that stage I stood just behind the Honda Ballade, Mr Chairperson, on the side of the tar road.
In other words, the Honda was at that stage between you and the black people?
No, I stood on the side of the road of the Honda Ballade.   If you stand in front of the vehicle, on the right-hand side.
That is why I ask you, and where were the black people then?
The black people were on my left-hand side, they sat on the embankment.

Certain questions were put to them, or Mr Martins asked them certain questions regarding what political party they belonged to.   He repeated his question, I don't remember how many times.   Mr Kloppers stood behind the people and would tap them over the head with this baton.
Did you hear the answers of these people?
A while later, Mr Etienne Visser came to me and said to me that I must prepare myself we're going to shoot and take that thing out.
I cannot precisely say where he came from.
Who do you thought this instruction came from?
I thought that it could only have been from the seniors, namely Chief Commander Martins, Chief Commander Kloppers and Commandant Martins.
As Visser told it to you, Mr Visser and I moved around at the same time, we took our positions in and Mr Martins then shot the first shot.
Before you continue, where did you station yourself?
It was in front of the Honda Ballade.
And how can you say that it was Deon Martins who shot the first shot?
I saw when the first shot rang.
After that shot was fired, everybody started shooting.
My pipe shotgun was loaded, I fired one round in the direction of the people, I turned it around, I put another round in it, and also fired off the other round in the direction of the people.
I only executed an order that was given to me.
How much ammunition did you have with you?
How many rounds are in there?

After the shooting someone shouted there's a vehicle on the way, certain people jumped into the Sentra, it was on its way, I shouted "Stop", I wanted to get in as well, I ran across the road and Chief Commandant Klopper then shouted that "We will meet you at the town hall".
And you then got into the Sentra and drove to the town hall?
And eventually where did you disperse that evening?
From the town hall, we went to Jaco Badenhorst's parents' house.

There we waited for Chief Commander Kloppers, and later, a while later, Kloppers and Martins and Etienne Visser arrived.   Kloppers said to me that I have to go and look in front of the Mercedes on the passenger's seat, there's a bag, I must go and fetch it.   I did it.    I handed over the bag and out of the bag he took the ear of a black man.
It was asked who fired shots, and everybody who had weapons with them said that they shot.  Mr Diedericks was not at Mr Badenhorst's house.
Was comments made regarding the ear?

Mr Kloppers showed us the ear and said that the next morning he will hand the ear over to General Oelofse.   From there on we went home.   I went with Kloppers and Visser also went with us.   We first dropped Visser off at his house and then Kloppers dropped me off at my house, where I handed him the pipe shotgun that he gave me that evening.
Mr Chairman, I note that it is four o'clock.   I don't know until what time you mean to sit, but if you want to adjourn now, it is a convenient stage?

I think it's a convenient time to adjourn until tomorrow at half past nine.
